body.note: The preferred method for creating reference sets is via specification refsets. For large refsets, this method usually involves fewer steps and is easier to maintain. A specification refset is essentially a recipe created by refset developers for enumerating the members of a member refset.

section.title: Overview of creation process
section.p: The process of creating a member refset usually entails creating 2 additional auxilliary refsets - one to hold the specification of the refset in terms of a query expression; the second to hold all the ancestors of the members of the refset, known as the "refset member parents". The latter refset can be used to assist in navigation of the taxonomic hierarchy. The refset creator not only needs to create the concepts of the three refsets, but has to additionally specify the refset contents using the specification refset and a special refset query language, and then process this specification to generate the members of the refset and parent refset. The member refset, and its associated specification refset and marked parent refset should be created as concepts in the taxonomy, before any of the refset contents are specified. One can think of these steps as creating "empty" refset containers.

entry.note: Before creating any reference sets, the IHTSDO Workbench IDE must be configured appropriately. see Understanding the Preferences Panel.
